website_summaries.verdict: Generously sized pitcher removes an amazing level of dissolved solids. Stores a generous amount of fresh water.
pros: Impressive 5.4-litre capacity makes it great for families
Includes a meter for monitoring water quality
cons: Hard water limits the life of the filter
Water tastes strange when the filter needs replaced

customer_reviews.title: 777 ain't lucky...
customer_reviews.text: ...when it is the TDS reading for my well-water. I thought ZeroWater was the answer to my prayers--and it was, for FOUR days. For 4 days I had perfect water, but on the 5th day the water tasted like lemons, which is "the sign" that it's time to change the filter. According to ZeroWater's very friendly & sympathetic customer service rep, with the high TDS content in my water, each ZeroWater filter will give me about 8 gallons of wonderfully clean-tasting water. It's far cheaper for me to buy Walmart purified water (which has 006 TDS, btw) and pour it into my filterless $45 23-cup ZeroWater container than it is to buy filters. Can't fault ZeroWater--much. And yeah, I cried.
customer_reviews.author: FuldaRussell

customer_reviews.title: Best way to make your filters last a long time
customer_reviews.text: Best tasting water ever. I live in West Fargo, ND the tap water here is horrible so it ls pointless using it unless I want to go through a new filter every 2-3weeks. What I do for my filters to last month's is go to my nearest grocery store and fill up a 5gallon jug of their filtetered water for $1.95 and then run it through my zero water system and a single filter lasts me half a year. Problem solved. I refill my 5gallon jug every weekend btw
customer_reviews.author: Frandy A.

customer_reviews.title: Hardware on the Spout is not durable but Customer Service is Great
customer_reviews.text: The water tastes fine and I bought two of the 23-cup dispenser. The 2nd one had a leak with the spout which was promptly replaced by Amazon. The replaced one only worked for about 6 months before the blue button snapped off. The button has only a narrow white plastic stem to hold against a heavy spring. This is a weak link. That should have been a stainless piece instead of plastic. Looks like I am not the only one with this problem. Update:- I contacted ZeroWater and informed them about my problem. Customer service sent me a new one without charge. While the spout design is not durable but customer service is great.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Y

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product!! Filters last 2 days and then taste disgusting
customer_reviews.text: Terrible!!! This product uses filters that only worked for 2-3 days before needing a new one! I contacted the Zero water company and they said depending on where you live and how much your water needs to be filtered it's possible the filters might only last a day or two (and they are not cheap!) what a freakin rip off! I was so excited to have this in my home only to be totally disappointed. The water started to taste like very sour batteries after running water through the filter after a couple days. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I give it a ZERO for its water!
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money. Going straight in the trash since I can't return now that I don't have the box . Works great for the first week or so but then gives the water an acidic taste. Our water is 200 ppm so the filter should have lasted longer per their guidelines. Started doing more research and it seems that it's acidic because that's how they get water to 0 ppm. By using chemicals and acid to break down the particles. Then the water has a terrible taste and ph balance which can't be good for you.
customer_reviews.author: Shruti

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water onto countertop
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews saying these things leak water but I really wanted 000 water so I took a chance and sure enough, it leaks water onto the countertop. I keep a sponge there and wipe it up about 3Xdaily. I'm sure you've read about how little water you actually get from a $10 filter. My tap water is 450, it could be cheaper to buy bottled water and when you consider the leaking spigot this thing hasn't made me a satisfied customer. It's been in use a couple of weeks and now I'm looking forward to having fishy smelling filtered water leaking onto my countertop. How do they get away with selling this defective product? Buyer beware, you've been warned
customer_reviews.author: Ed Abbey

customer_reviews.title: Filter doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: This product's water filter was working well until we hit the 30 day mark. Weird pieces were going into the water like yellowish and when I removed the filter the top was that color. Very bad experience for this "0" water. Never again. Sticking with Brita Brand
customer_reviews.author: David Cedeno

customer_reviews.title: but it does not taste good. Also
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says for reducing particulates, down to 0%, but it does not taste good. Also, very weak lip lid; breaks easily. I have a Brita that filters the same water from one Huntington Beach faucet, and these taste very different. I bought the Zero as a "better replacement for the Brita", but after a month now, I think that I have to go back to the Brita, or find an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: mattroffact

customer_reviews.title: Filter doesn't work. Makes water less pure.
customer_reviews.text: I have the small ZeroWater filter and it works great. I bought this bigger one for a friend. He said it for one week and water tasted good. Now it tastes terrible. I tested the filter waterTDS and it reads 564 ppm. The tap water I put in it reads 387 ppm. The filter is actually making the water less pure.
customer_reviews.author: rezlef

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expecations
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I was skeptical about the filters. Zero TDS??? Well, happy to say that I am now a believer. My first filter was supposed to last about 25-35 gallons, but we estimate we got close to 60 gallons out of it. Our TDS meters both read about 320 PPM, so the filter outlasted what was expected. We calculated how much it takes in gas and time to go have our 5-gallon jugs filled at 35 cents a gallon, and found that to make it cost-effective we bought a case of 16 filters, but it is sooo nice not to have to carry the jugs! We bought a second filter for our R/V, too.
customer_reviews.author: T. G. Peranteau

customer_reviews.title: SPOUT DECIDED TO START LEAKING IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT AFTER ONLY HAVING IT FOR 2 WEEKS. Beware
customer_reviews.text: I have not even had this water dispenser for a month and it has already broke. I woke up this morning to find a kitchen full of water because the dispenser spout had been leaking all night. It had worked fine for about 2 weeks.. thinking it would be fine over night and I could trust it. Nope. Woke up to a ruined kitchen floor. I’m SO disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: changing filter every 3 weeks not worth.
customer_reviews.text: We are a family of 3 people and in just 30 days of filter change the count turns to more than 008. We use water in s optimal way and in limits ( you can say we use 20 cups daily) The water has tiny black particles once the count says 004. And only after one month the product behaves like this. Until then the product return policy is expired. The blue button is also little difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dr ST

customer_reviews.title: Never purchase people this poisonous product!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was using it and it was ok, I was testing water every 3 days. Last time I test water TDS was 000. Yesterday I felt metal taste iny mouth,started stomach pain. Today also I have drink lots of "filtered water". Then my son told me that he can't drink water, it has horrible taste. I thought I have metal taste in my mouth. I was shoked when I tested TDS and it was 198. Shame on you company. You are poisoning people. How it can be that TDS raised from 0 to 198 in 3 days????
customer_reviews.author: Giorgi

customer_reviews.title: I had bad luck with this ZeroWater setup
customer_reviews.text: I ordered ZeroWater and right away it seemed to take forever for water to filter. After a few days it stopped, tried another Zero Water filter and after a day or two, it stopped with water still in the reserve. I was so hoping for a filter that works longer then a day or two I went back and ordered a anther brand 10 Cup system.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin G.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Bought it about a month ago and it seemed great, I kept it in fridge. About 2 weeks in, I noticed water on the floor but figured it was the kids. Then one day, I go to open the drawer on the bottom of the fridge and it was literally filled with water as well as the bottom of the inside of the fridge. I pulled it out and sat it on the counter, hangin into the sink and watch it leak constantly. By the time I realized the issue, my return time had passed.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for 2 weeks and then the water tasted sour. I dumped the water out and followed all the instructions as to cleaning it. I did a test run and the water still tasted sour. I live alone, I’m the only one using this pitcher. The filter should not need to be replaced after 2 weeks of use. I just requested a refund. I’m packing it up now to return. I’ve ordered a Brita product.
customer_reviews.author: lynnette boyer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this received this on July 16. It worked great filled it up tested the water and it was at zero. About 5 days later there was a weird taste to the water, but still drinkable. By July 26th the taste to the water was so bad that I stopped drinking it. I tested the water and this time it came back 147. My tap water measures 748. The water would leave a funky taste that would stick to the back of your throat. Is it possible the filter is defective? Maybe, but then why would the number to test the impurities in the water be so low. Would I recommend it? The answer is no.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: An indispensable part of my family's health and life
customer_reviews.text: This 23 cup refrigerator ZeroWater filter and dispenser is now indispensable to our family. Our bottled water has some things in it that we don't like. Filtered through this filter, we are left with water without bitterness or any unpleasant taste. We used this system at least 8 to 10 times a day and finally we wore out the button, so we gladly and quickly ordered this one. We only had to wait a couple of days but we had a supply of cold Zero Water in gallon jugs set aside so we were not without. May this one last us for years as the previous one did.
customer_reviews.author: Cajun GourmetTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Takes for ever to fill and my thumb hurts
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh. I was excited to get a bigger filter and an easier despenser so my 7 year old would be able to use it as well. It has been a nightmare. It takes FOREVER to filter and YES, I have taken it apart and tried all the different ways of putting it in... but nothing is working. My thumb has been bothering for for about the past week and it wasn't until today that I realized it is because I have to press sooooo hard to release the water. I am so bummed I threw the box away, I would be returning in a heart beat if I didn't.
customer_reviews.author: lwebster

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste
customer_reviews.text: I dont know if it's the TDS reader or if I just got a faulty filter but since day one my normal tap water has a reading that is lower, unfiltered than that of the reading once "filtered". I'm feeling like this thing is complete garbage. How is it possible that water that goes through the system is more dangerous than the water you dump in? For reference I live in southern Arizona the water here is extremely hard and I would never in my life drink the tap water... The first picture is the reading for my tap water (383) the second is what came out of zero water filter (516).
customer_reviews.author: China Garcia

customer_reviews.title: ZERO durability ZERO Quality ZERO Ethics 100% Thievery
customer_reviews.text: The dispenser broke in 6 months of use. The dispenser broke while filling the water.That's not even the fun part. No 3rd party faucet assembly will fit this. You guessed it.No parts available from the manufacturer...But i got 12 filters and had to buy a new one...RAT RACE. Zero water = Zero Ethics, making money by keeping consumer hostage by NOT supplying parts and manufacturing products that does NOT take3rd party manufactured parts.
customer_reviews.author: Mahesh R. Rajannan

customer_reviews.title: Look for a better model
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a month or so but then started leaking from the button you push to dispense he water. It doesn’t leak when not in use but still is very annoying. Added 6/17/19 - Hey I just noticed my review for this product was hidden by the water filter company. Very classy move on their part. Here’s an idea, maybe instead of you hiding negative reviews about your product, you should make it right with the customers. Only a piece of garbage would hide an honest review from a customer.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Geraci

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough good things about zero water filter. To be able to take out all dissolved solids is amazing and something you usually pay a lot of money for with reverse osmosis systems. Granted it is not a reverse osmosis water filtration system but you can still polish your water off with this filter if you wish After the filtration. But normally if you’re not using well water that would be needed anyway if your municipality has halfway decent water this would be a perfect solution for you.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: BEST WATER EVER
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after drinking liters of it at a friend's house. This water tastes awesome. It is barely-there water that feels light to drink and when it's sitting in my stomach (which means I've been drinking so much more since getting the filter). The filter is easy to assemble, easy to fill (although it would be nice if the top snapped into place instead of just sitting on top), and filters water rather quickly. I highly doubt another type of water filter will ever enter my home!
customer_reviews.author: Sidney

customer_reviews.title: Better than Brita!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying this because I thought, "How different can it be?" VERY different. The ZeroWater water tastes so clean... it actually takes some getting used to. My Brita pitcher started leaking so I thought I'd give ZeroWater a try. The system comes with a water tester because you're supposed to change the filter when you hit 6 ppm total devolved solids. The first thing I did was test the Brita water. It was 90 ppm. ZeroWater was, of course, 0 ppm. Bonus: the filters are reasonably priced for what they do!
customer_reviews.author: Sean00

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated..... I want to keep it sooo bad!
customer_reviews.text: When we first received the ZeroWater dispenser it worked great. The filter then started draining very slowly or not at all. We put in the for the return and then offered to send a new one. Accepted that choice; as it is large enough for our family of 4 without feeling like we are constantly refilling it. The new one came filter needed to be replaced about 2 months later. Orders a box of 4 filters. Less than 20 days later the filter is draining slowly again. Unfortunately I missed the mark on the return date for the dispenser but I didn’t on the water filters. Product is great if they could just get the system working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Erin M.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: The flavor, or really lack, of the water if fabulous. The filter lasts a long time. The ability to test the water to determine when to change the filter takes the guess work out of the process and saves filters. I have purchased 3 of these because the first one was perfect. The last 2 have leaked around the spigot. I took the first one apart hoping to find the cause. I did not. I was able to keep the first one in the refrigerator so the water was always cold. Now I have to filter the water and transfer it to another container or constantly deal with the flooding.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Ouding

customer_reviews.title: not sure if the tester trustable
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I did when I received this is to test different water. The tap water of New York City which is where I live is metered 39. After Zero filtered is literally 0... I also tested the other popular brand that I used to use, it got surprisingly 28. I can't help start wondering if the tester made specially to defeat its competitor...still can't believe this...lol... Also, the speed of the water drip is slightly slower than the other brand, while it doesn't affect the usage. I still enjoy it and bought a second one for my aunt. Good product overall. :)
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Lu

customer_reviews.title: The filter made me sick - POISONED.
customer_reviews.text: The design and construction of the container and spigot are ver good, BUT the reason that I bought this to drink claen water. After using this daily for several months I began to feel very sick. Poisoned. I went to my health care provider and she said that she had other patients that had similar problems with zero water. An online search resulted in many complaints about the same thing. I'd like my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S.

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes acidic/bitter from day 1 and turns sour after a few days ... Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible. The TDS meter reads 0, but it makes the water acidic from day 1 and becomes worse and worse every day. The water is bitter in the beginning, and after a few days changes into sour. Totally undrinkable. And if you have acid reflux problems, forget it. Called them up, they replaced the filter free, the same thing happened. Called them up again, refused to take it back and now Amazon is not showing option to return/refund the product. What a waste! Save your money
customer_reviews.author: Shah

customer_reviews.title: great filter, but watch your minerals
customer_reviews.text: So far I've run 7 gallons of water through this filter. It come out tasting crisp and tingly in my mouth. Makes great coffee too. Our municipal water tastes terrible and in summer it stinks too. This filter is a great relief but I still have to drink some tap water. Why? Because I'm human and I need minerals. The ZeroWater people never mention that they are taking out the essential minerals needed to sustain life. But it's a great product, well designed and using quality materials as far as I can see. I also bought the smaller 8 Cup Pitcher so that I can do the filter cycling trick you will read about in another review.
customer_reviews.author: swell

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost of the filters. Glad I have product.
customer_reviews.text: Gave this a four. Tester only worked 3 times. I have to determine if a new filter is needed by TASTE. Changing filter about once each month. Purchased March 5, 2020. (4-16, 5-12, 6-12, and 7-7) I live alone, and use approximately 50 ounces each day. Costing me right at $10 each month. Same as Publix but more convenient because at 80 years old I don’t have to carry gallon jugs of water.
customer_reviews.author: M Ross

customer_reviews.title: Just the best water for home or offuce
customer_reviews.text: Zero water is an intensely filtered water purification home system that we wont live without! The included tester keeps us on top of when we need to change out the filter. We've used that same tester when visiting friends who bragged about their whole house water filtration system ...we bought along some Zero water and did a particulate test..they were in disbelief as their water was well over 220 ppm and our water was ZERO. Cant beat the crisp, clean taste..and weve NEVER found any black mold inside the filtered water tank. Save the olanet and stop killing your back dragging in case adter case of bottled water. Its not good for so many reasons. Go ZERO..be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Klyber

customer_reviews.title: Best tasting water from a pitcher EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best tasting water from a pitcher ever. I live in a region with a lot of mountains and our water usually tasted like minerals. Even from the fridge filtered water. This pitcher makes my water taste soft and it tests at 3. I have had this for 3 weeks now and it is still testing at 6. I am beyond thrilled with this pitcher. Our household consumption is relatively low, as there are only two of us. I figure we will have to replace the filter about once a month. This equates to about $10 a month if I buy the 6 pack of filters. 110% worth it!
customer_reviews.author: HannahSmith

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. The company totally stands behind their product. I received mine from Amazon on August 21 I opened it cleaned it and filled it. Unfortunately it was leaking from the spigot a continuous drip. I emailed Zero Water directly and explained the issue asked if I should just return to Amazon. The emailed me back apologized for the problem and asked for my address so they could ship me a new one no questions asked. I received a new one today and it works perfectly. I was so amazed by their customer service. I wholeheartedly support Zero Water. Great product and great company.
customer_reviews.author: Robert White

customer_reviews.title: Replacement filters don’t filter
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! As you will find... the original filter was amazing. However, the replacement filters do not filter as the original. I wrote the company and the “graciously” sent out another 2 pack of filters...what a joke!!! They were also terrible. It reads on the meter right away and tastes like metal. Absolute bait and switch!!! Do not waste your money. I read another review that went to a RO system so I will be looking into that one cautiously because I researched the Zero what I thought to be thoroughly. I was very very wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Matthews

customer_reviews.title: worked great! Then Started leaking!
customer_reviews.text: I Absolutely loved this filter for the 3 1/2 months it worked. We have horrible tap water here in Long Beach, CA. I have never been able to swallow a gulp of its tap water till now. It is a awesome product as far as it's filtering ability, but the spigot leaks likes crazy. After about 3 months, half of the water in the container would LEAK out. I didn't even have a chance to order a new filter cause the unit was faulty. I will have to resume my water bottling service.
customer_reviews.author: abraham

customer_reviews.title: Purest water filtration system on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Purest water filtration system on the market. I have it next to my refrigerator in the kitchen and I use it daily. The system is slightly pricey, but amortized over time and compared to bottled water, it's a no-brainer investment in your good health.
customer_reviews.author: TomHunter1968

customer_reviews.title: Filter doesn't last more than 2 weeks, making it a very expensive water filter system!
customer_reviews.text: Everything is as described and it's awesome until the filter stops filtering. After 2 weeks of using it I've stated to notice black particles around top of the filter and a metallic taste of the water. The TDS meter shows 10 but the water has a strong metallic taste to it making it undrinkable. I will not buy new filters every 2 weeks so this is now junk. Would not recommend it! (In the beginning i got TDS readings around 450. I live in southern California)
customer_reviews.author: hbotev

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I did my research before I bought this particular filter and this was rated the highest by consumer reports. It has not disappointed. My well water has a high mineral content and though it doesn't taste bad, it does have a mineral taste to it. I've been using this filter for my drinking water and it really works. Water that's been filtered tastes even better than the bottled water I was buying and it's so easy to put together and use. I haven't had to change the filter yet so I can't really comment on how long this will last, but it's well worth the modest price.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The water came out tasting horrible ! Chemical taste. Brita from Costco is waaaay better. Not to mention it filters soooo slowly, you'd have to wait 10 minutes then fill again and repeat just to get a full load.
customer_reviews.author: Surfer

customer_reviews.title: Tastes good,saves money and trips to the store!
customer_reviews.text: I did a taste test with my daughter and son in law comparing the zero water to bottled water when it first arrived. The zero water tasted just as good. No after taste or unpleasant taste. Also the 2 brands of bottled water did not register 0. They registerd low in contaminates but it told me I was on the right track in keeping this product. The only problem, and it is a personal one perhaps, is that I wish I had gotten the largest container available because I drink and cook with the water and it goes quickly, and is slow to filter. Nevertheless I am saving alot of money, effort and trips to the store for water.
customer_reviews.author: pattipat

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy, Customer Service does not care
customer_reviews.text: Received the unit on Jun 1st. And it no longer filters the water. You fill the reservoir and the water just sits in the tank. Tried the trouble shooting to remove the filter and place it back on. Still nothing. Highly disappointed, tried zerowater customer service, no response after multiple attempts. Follow up tried new filters, worked fine one time. No longet works. Tried to clear the filter, etc...Tried customer service and was basically told to bad. Substandard quality and substandard customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Franks

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. The first two weeks the water tasted great. Then, it started tasting very citrusy. I looked inside and the filter was leaking particles into the water. I googled the issue and many others have had the same problem. This filter breaks very quickly. Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.author: Business Always

customer_reviews.title: Been Using ZeroWater over a year!
customer_reviews.text: My tap water is around 300ppm. This filter gets it to 0ppm to start then slowly climbs the more you use it. I swap out the filter when it reaches 250ppm The water tastes great and I drink a lot of water. I have the travel tumbler, the pitcher and this big reservoir that I keep in the fridge. I also buy filtered 5 gallon bottles from Grocery store four bottles at a time for backup. I'll keep using ZeroWater Products until I install a permanent filtration system for the entire house.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brletich

customer_reviews.title: this product is really really bad
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this zero water product and replacement cartridges for at least 1 year. BUT now the replacement cartridges have all been bad. the water quality is over 105 vs. 0.00 and there is small amounts of charcoal/sand in the replacement filters. I have written the supplier requesting money back BUT no response whatsoever. Recommend another product
customer_reviews.author: Henry R.

customer_reviews.title: Love the zero water
customer_reviews.text: I had the 30 glass. This is 23 and I like it just as much plus it is a bit lighter, so is easier to move to the fridge once full. I fill every other day usually. I even use this water for pasta making and everything else, for example if I cook corn or if I boil eggs. I have to clean the mesh filter on my faucet about once a week because it catches so much rust. It's pretty disgusting. This is much nicer and tastes great too. I've been using ZeroWater filter for 5 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Violetwrites Leftow

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy materials
customer_reviews.text: I was taking this out of the plastic and cardboard box over my sink area. When it came out it fell into the sink as expected as I was going to wash it before using it. Well, the corner of the into shattered and a hole was in it. Flimsy plastic! Very thin. Can’t see how they can sell an item that is made this cheaply. It fell in a stainless steel sink and got a hole in it!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: rebecca m swartz

customer_reviews.title: Mold plus after 8 gallons requires new filter
customer_reviews.text: Nothing can prepare you for zero water, which without minerals tastes terrible. In my case water in Arizona takes a new filter every 8 gallons. Plus over Thanksgiving while out of town, the container rendered mold. Zero water is not a good value... Or safe.
customer_reviews.author: GeeWiz

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to replace my old one.
customer_reviews.text: They work great. All you have to do is to screw the filter into the trough and then pour water ON THE FILTER! If you do not pour the water on the filter the water will sit in the trough for an entire day. The way to cure that problem is to pour the first load of water directly onto the mouth of the filter. After that, it works just fine. With my water, I change filters once a month. The frequency of your filter changes will be a factor of how hard your water is.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Selene

customer_reviews.title: ConsumerLab.com rated ZeroWater dispenser extremely high in adding microplastic particles to water.
customer_reviews.text: The ZeroWater dispenser actually adds micro-plastic particles to the water you put in the device. The water put in the dispenser had 33.5 micro-plastic particles per liter, but when it was run through the dispenser it came out with 437.4 particles. This indicates the water is absorbing plastic from the dispenser. It is a micro-plastic contaminator for drinking water.
customer_reviews.author: PERCEPTRONZ

customer_reviews.title: I'm not going to use it anymore
customer_reviews.text: It is expensive to use it, the filter last just for 3 weeks. After that it start having an horrible flavor and then, when You get to see the particles it has ..... there are a lot in there. It was expensive to buy a filter every 3 weeks, because they're 14dls each one. We decided to buy another brand and it last longer and the filter are cheaper, and of course... the horrible flavor is not there anymore. I won't recommend to buy this pitcher, unless you want to spend a lot of money .
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a week and the water has a terrible taste. It almost tasted “woodsy” and now tastes like “fish”. My family all hates the way the filter makes it taste! I will be contacting the company. I am very disappointed! I test the water regularly and it initially tested at 003 and within a week at 256!
customer_reviews.author: E. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: GREAT. until it stops working properly.
customer_reviews.text: At first it was great. Perfect neutral water. then after about a month it all of a sudden tasted like lemon. It was fine one day then the very next day was bad. I tested the water with the tester and it showed over 800ppm, my tap water is only at 300-400ppm. I did some research and found this. [...] This is exactly what happened. Now I am stuck with this and I have to use it because of the cost. Eventually I will switch to something else. I was very disappointed with the product after this happened. Other than that it is well built and no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Water is great for a week or so then it tastes so horrible we can't drink it.
customer_reviews.text: The first time we thought maybe one of our kids used a dirty cup to refill it. We cleaned it, changed the filter, and talked to the kids to be sure they are careful. In less than a week, it happened again. We cleaned it and changed the filter again. A few more days passed, and the water is just undrinkable again. We’re changing to another brand of filter.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey C. Wiseman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Zero pitcher. I was disappointed and disgusted by the filter when I opened the package. There must not have good quality control system. I will not buy another Zero item.
customer_reviews.author: Annice

customer_reviews.title: No More Chlorine Smell or Taste!
customer_reviews.text: The chlorine in our water is so bad, our eyes burn during a shower - and we couldn't use the water - even in our coffee or tea. Zero Water works beautifully! We keep two 1-gallon jugs in our refrigerator, so we have an ample supply of cold water to drink. We use a qrt-size measuring cup to dispense the water - or we lift out the filter section and pour the water into the measuring cup for refilling jugs - or to pour in the coffee maker. (If you remove the water tray for pouring, keep the unit supported, so you won't break off the filter)
customer_reviews.author: FredB

customer_reviews.title: Worthless... I have gone through 2 filters in 3 weeks before it starts tasting sour
customer_reviews.text: There are 4 of us using this as our main source of water and no joke, we have gone through 2 filters in 3 weeks. It costs about $50 for 4 filters so at that run rate it will cost us $300 in filters every year... completely ridiculous. This is near scam level. Completely regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: M_A_DataAnalyst

customer_reviews.title: Came apart !!
customer_reviews.text: The dispenser button on this literally came out and shot across the room ! There is a button you press on this to dispense water through the spout. The button is spring loaded, and whatever is supposed to hold it in place failed. I could not see a way to repair it. Too much trouble and expense to return this, so I just took the loss on it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jester

customer_reviews.title: Does not completely fill.
customer_reviews.text: The whole point of a large capacity container is to fill it, and not have to refill it as often. The filtering system for ZERO water does not work. The pitcher fills about1/2-way, and then the remaining unfiltered water sits in the above reservoir and get's stagnant. I googled this issue and found several suggestions to fix it... tapping filter (to get air out of it), running some test water through the filter, replacing the filter. NONE worked, it's poor design, and it's frustrating and an expensive mistake. DO NOT make the same mistake I did. I should have never switched from Brita.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great... For about a week.
customer_reviews.text: The water tasted great for a week, and now it tastes 'ile lemon. The company website says that this is due to an "exhausted" filter, but unless they gave us an old filter in the box, I can't see how this is possible. So I'm returning it after a week and getting a new one from a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: i have a 10-cup ZeroWater. I love it, never any issues. I bought the 23-cup so I could give my dogs filtered water. It's a royal pain. Filter keeps getting air locks and I have to pull the filter unit (the container the filter screws into and the filter) out, drain the water in the top, bang the filter against the side of my kitchen sink multiple times, put it all back together, and refill with water. If I had only known....
customer_reviews.author: Mary C. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Impurities out.
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. It slowly started filtering all the bad things inside tap water and I was shockingly surprised how much bad things bottled water companies put inside their products. The numbers speak for themselves once you test it with the meter. Numbers skyrocket on water you thought was safe to consume. But once you purify your own water and see the meter reading 0 you even taste the difference and learn to appreciate the goodness this filter system does. Not only do you save money by buying polluted water, but you're also in for a healthier intake of fluids for your body. In the end, your body will thank you for it. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This water tastes better than bottled water. I’m truly shocked at how good it tastes. This is my first filtered water pitcher and I wasn’t liking the reviews on Brita so I researched Zero Water and liked what I read. The only downside is it takes forever to fill up the pitcher but other than that, I love it! This will definitely save money on bottled water. AND it was super affordable for the size we bought. If you’re on the fence about this pitcher, don’t be! Buy it now!
customer_reviews.author: CassieDSm

customer_reviews.title: spout breaks
customer_reviews.text: I love the way zero water filters remove the bad stuff and gives great tasting water. The first one's container cracked and leaked after 2 years. My second one just had the spout break off after 4 years. I just filled a water bottle and the spout popped off. I had to get it over to the sink to avoid water on the counter. I ended up with water all over the floor. The lid on the top is in two parts and it is not made well. The, top lids fall off when putting it in & out of the fridge. Zero water really needs to redesign and improve the 23 gallon picture. I won't by it again.
customer_reviews.author: Skiler

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Three of the 5 filters i ordered did not work. And when they do work it gives so few refills it would be cheaper to buy bottled water of the same quality. A real mess to try to get a non working filter out to put in another one. The water tastes funny but it probably does a good job of filtering when it works. This was a waste of money. I went back to using my Aquasana filter which connects on the kitchen faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Filters last one week!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this product! After one week the filtered water started tasting like chemicals. I tested the ppm and it had gone from 0 to 80 overnight. I emailed the company thinking I had gotten a defective filter and they told me NO, in your part of the country the filter only works for 12 gallons of water. In other words I’d have to buy 4 filters a month totaling $60 to have water that doesn’t taste like chemicals. I feel scammed. I just ordered a Brita instead.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey King Jr

customer_reviews.title: Love these water filter systems, not crazy about the design of this particular one
customer_reviews.text: The actual pitcher is fine and the water filters really well. I had a problem with the location of the tester. It is easily dislodged and because the location of it is over the floor because of the location of the water spot it fell out onto the floor soon after I got it. I thought it was ok until I realized that it always registered 000. Luckily I have a smaller unit which included a tester which works. Too bad. The new tester is useless.
customer_reviews.author: cbsully01886

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes horrible impossible to drink!
customer_reviews.text: After using it for 2 months water started tasting like sour weird taste. I changed filers nothing helps its impossible to drink this water. Do not buy save your money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine55551

customer_reviews.title: Zero Filter
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Zero filter before, and now ordered this new one. I had this filter for many years, and button for the spout broke. I have no complaints. Nothing last forever. So, now I have this new one from Amazon and I love this one too. It is a new and improved model. I was happy with the last one, happy with this one and highly recommend. Delivery was excellent, even during this pandemic. Nothing negative here, only positive things to say.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Dehaven

customer_reviews.title: It's not like the older ones
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened to this company. I own one a few years ago and it would take the water a while to run through it. This one runs through the filter in seconds, and yes, it's sealed well. By it's own standards the meter says 175 not zoro! Maybe it's just a bad filter. I ordered another filter pack. If this doesn't work work, I'm done!
customer_reviews.author: A User

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Not worth your money
customer_reviews.text: I wish i could give it a 5 star. When i first purchased it and it worked out well. After a month of using it - i noticed it doesn’t filter well. Water would just sit on the top. I did my research and many people suggested to “burp” the box by picking up the white top to release air. It didn’t work so i had to call the company and they were willing to replace the filter. It worked well for another month and the same issue came back. Now the water tastes so bad. Filter was supposed to last 6 months but only had the new filter for a month. Not worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PLAIN OLD 💧. FINALLY!
customer_reviews.text: This wwas amazing! Area for me is Clifton,NJ. As you will notice, IDID 2 tests; different glasses. They were clean and dry out of the cupboard. (DW) FIRST TEST, straight from the tap. SECOND TEST, straight from the containerz spout. Simple to Use: This was the first filtration system that NOT REQUIRE A FILTER PREFLUSH. The 💧 had no taste at all! Just plain old 💧! YAAAZZZ!
customer_reviews.author: Kahlyssa

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the dispensing valve...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! 23 cup Zero Water filter dispensing valve failed 1 week after recieved. Dumped over 1/2 gallon of water on my kitchen floor overnight. Had to clean it up, and as a result I was late for work. That cost me serious dollars. Gee, thank you Zero water for the wonderful Christmas present...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and replacement leaks
customer_reviews.text: This company has gone downhill. I used to own one of their glass containers. It lasted over 10 years and never leaked. I accidentally cracked it and needed a replacement. The one I replaced it with leaked, so I called the company and they sent a replacement. That one leaked even more. The meters they sent to measure when it needed to be replaced did not work in either unit. Done with this company.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Finehout

customer_reviews.title: One flaw ruined the entire product.
customer_reviews.text: This product works great and the water tastes amazing up until it reaches 003 but thats not for a while. The one issue is that after only a few months of use the rubber piece inside the nozzle flipped around and now it doesn’t dispense water and they make it so the nozzle can’t be removed so that the rubber can be realigned. In addition the warranty is only 90 days
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Bad Filter
customer_reviews.text: After 5 days the water passing through the filter tasted sour... very unfortunate to have a product not last, specially considering the price point of each filter being $10+++ dollars... I’m better off buying bottled water, not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: israel

customer_reviews.title: This product makes your water a) better for you and  b) taste better.
customer_reviews.text: My wife is extremely sensitive to impurities in tap water. This filter delivers water she enjoys drinking, making tea/coffee with, cooking with, etc. It's also much less expensive than bottled water (she dislikes most brands of bottled water too because they don't "taste right" to her) and it's much more environmentally friendly. We're not producing a lot of plastic waste and that's better for the environment.
customer_reviews.author: computergeek

customer_reviews.title: Cleaner water has never been tasted.
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever wanted to taste JUST water? This filter can give you the opportunity to do just that. If you live in an area where the plumbing "contributes" taste to the water, this filter will remove that and give you pure water. The filter meter is easy to use. The whole unit fits on the top shelf of my fridge. The only thing that I saw that was surprising was that the filter seemed to work better (i.e. filter more water before "water level equilibrium" was met) in the fridge than out of the fridge. Overall, worth the money if you are looking for a water filter.
customer_reviews.author: Batfanatic

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: This product stopped working for me on Day 1. I previously had the Zero Water pitcher but tried to upgrade to this as I go through a lot of water a day. The spout started leaking about 6 hours after I had assembled it and used it - i.e. leaking heavily which won't work as I keep it in my fridge. The filter then also stopped working after only having been filled once and no water was being filtered anymore. Returning this item and trying the Brita 18 gallon next
customer_reviews.author: Barnacle

customer_reviews.title: Will not last past a few weeks. Terrible production.
customer_reviews.text: This filter tastes and works great however its so badly manufactured, the button broke in less than 3 months now. The spring came off and itnturns out its attached to a tiny tiny little white piece of plastic.. its so bad, i have to throw the whole unit away because of terrible production. That and the lid is impossible to keep ok it, everytime u need to fill it, it collapses or just falls off the filter because its just places there and has no fitting design. I had a brita for 3 years never had a single issue with it. Very disappointed. What a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: RSM

customer_reviews.title: ZeroWater 23 cup Water Filter Pitcher
customer_reviews.text: We use this pitcher all day long. We’re big water drinkers and don’t always, like the taste of water from the faucet. This is our 2nd one and highly recommend them to everyone. Having the water quality meter is a great feature we us it to test the water from our faucet, water from the frig and check the water from the ZeroWater pitcher. It’s amazing the differences between them.
customer_reviews.author: Dundee

customer_reviews.title: This is the Best Water Purifier Ever!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this purifier!!!! We have used another water purifier for years, until the filters started to fail and sometimes the water tasted funny. We tried a couple others and then hit on ZeroWater. I love this purifier!!! It sits well on my counter, doesn't leak at all, holds lots of water, and the water tastes great. We live on a lake, so never drink out of the tap. ZeroWater is the best purifiers we have ever used! The filters work great, have a great seal, and being able to test our water with the tester that comes with it is an added bonus. I would highly recommend this brand to anyone that wants clear, better tasting, good water.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Works great for NYC tap water!
customer_reviews.text: Reading through the reviews, I saw that people have had issues with filters needing to be replaced frequently, which I understand is because of the high amount of particles/chemicals in those people’s tap water. I live in NYC, and luckily the reading on my tap water is around 045, which goes down to 000 when filtered. The water tastes great. So the filter has been great for me! I also saw that people have had issues with the spout on the glass dispenser. Hence why I chose the large, rectangular plastic one. Easy to use, sits on my counter, and holds the water tester. Works for me! All in all, I’m very happy!
customer_reviews.author: E. Eldredge

customer_reviews.title: Leaking spigot
customer_reviews.text: After 3 weeks of use the spigot is dripping. Pressed it in a couple of times and appears to shut tight. Have it over the sink for the night. If it continues to leak, what is my option. This wasn’t cheap to buy. Filter works as advertised. Update- leaked an entire coffee cup overnight UPDATE--I emptied the unit and found and removed a shaving of white plastic which I belive came from the cover. It had lodge itself in the gasket that seals the tap. Since then it works as advetised. I now would upgrade it to 5 stars, but I wonder how many others would have thown it away.
customer_reviews.author: BostonVaughn

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for better tasting water and lower PPM, this is a absolutely wonderful device.
customer_reviews.text: To anyone who doubts this - fear not. This thing really works (pictures included) If your goal is to 1) get better tasting water, and 2) lower TDS/PPM results, this is the filter for you. It took my tap water (632 PPM), down to 1 PPM. It also produced water that was much clearer, cleaner to taste, and more crisp. My GF loves this, she can no longer stand the water at her parents house because of this device. I'm typically pretty critical of items, and I honestly have nothing bad to say about this product. It's fantastic. It works. It does as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Dispenser valve leaks everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Everything seemed great at first. But its nusable because of a leaky dispenser valve, leaks everywhere when in use. So its garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Riles

customer_reviews.title: We've had 4- all defective & leaked
customer_reviews.text: We've had 4 of these over the past few years and they have all leaked from the spout part. We love how clean the filtered water is and the measuring stick is super helpful but all 4 of ours have been defective either right out of the box or within a few weeks of use. We finally just got a big 5 gallon jug machine for drinking because we've had such bad luck with these
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Khosh

customer_reviews.title: Won't stop dripping
customer_reviews.text: We got the 23 cup Zero Water and, until yesterday, would have given it 5 stars. We've only had it since the middle of May, but today, it started dripping. We have tried everything to figure out why, but can't stop the drip. This was delivered May 16th and the return window closed June 15th. Pretty expensive for something to work 6 weeks. I have tried to find a customer service number to contact, but haven't been able to. It has gone from a drip to a constant pour.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke and water has strange taste
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in May 2019 and was never happy with the taste or ability to fill the reservoir....but today the faucet button completely broke...the button snapped off and there is NO way to fix...so now I am stuck with expensive filters and no container. Would love a refund. End of story Don't buy this .
customer_reviews.author: Windy City Gal

customer_reviews.title: Started tasting like rust and lemon after 2 weeks, contaminates water worse than unfiltered tap!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thing like 2 weeks ago, but then all of a sudden it started tasting lemony and like it had rust in it. I thought it was my canteen, but I noticed it was coming from the water. I checked the meter they give you, and the filtered water literally double as contaminated as the unfiltered tap! My old roommate had a Britta of the same size and we both put gallons upon gallons through it for 4+ months, and you could still taste that it was better higher quality than the tap. This one went real bad in 2 weeks from just me.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great minus one design error
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very happy with this product, my only complaint is the lid. The container fits a lot of water in it which I like and that is the reason I bought this one. The lid on it is terrible, it just sits there and does not click. When it is full and you are bringing it to the fridge the lids starts falls out and water is leaking all over the place which is annoying. I have just learned to not completely fill it up but it’s a design issue for sure. I love the water tester though and its located right upfront making it so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jsnissan

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself in a week
customer_reviews.text: I drink a gallon of water per day. I tested my Brita pitcher water against my filtered faucet and refrigerator filtered water. Results below: faucet 147 refrigerator filtered 116 Brita 86 Zero 0 Any questions? Also, I use this water to make the best coffee i’ve ever had. I grind my own fresh roasted grounds. Pure perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Achievers

customer_reviews.title: Great filter, bad dispenser
customer_reviews.text: Love the filter. The dispenser is cheap and badly designed. The hinge on the lid broke soon after getting it and no longer lines up. The lid is always falling off and essentially useless. The dispenser is easy for my kids to use but the spigot is long and the water comes out towards the back near the filter so they are always pouring water on the floor. Wish they would design something that is not so cheaply made and badly designed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wise

customer_reviews.title: Saves Us Money and the Environment Bottles!
customer_reviews.text: We are heavy water drinkers, usually going through 2-3 35pk of water a week, and we also buy water for our 2 large dogs. This has been a great investment and has saved us a ton! We use this exclusively now and it tastes great, lasts a long time, and is easy to use. We have had the same filter on it for nearly 3 months now and it is just now needing to be changed according to the included TDS reader. We can't even taste a difference yet, so could probably go a bit longer even with the same filter. Great purchase and wish we would have bought sooner!
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: From 666 (or was it 999) to 001
customer_reviews.text: I may have been reading the initial display upside down, but it either read 666 or 999, either way, once I fill the container and re-tested, I made sure to read the display with the correct orientation, and my water then read 001. I know our water here is horrible, which is why I bought this product, but I wasn't expecting these high levels and didn't think this filter could reduce those levels so drastically.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson

customer_reviews.title: ZeroWater filters dont last as long as stated
customer_reviews.text: After reading several and using ZeroWater for 6 months now I feel this product is misleading as the water begins to taste bad after about a week of using a new filter. First it started tasting a little sour and then the fishy disgusting taste soon after. I guess you would have to change the filters every week for the water to taste as it should. Maybe the company should do more testing and be more truthful on how many times the filter needs to be changed.
customer_reviews.author: JMartel

customer_reviews.title: spout dribbles/leaks water from spout, hurts if you have arthritis to keep pushing in button
customer_reviews.text: After 10 days of use, when I finished pouring water and release the spout, water dribbles and leaks on the floor. I am returning it. -However the water tasted fantastic, better than our Aquagear pitcher. -Also, the spout is SLOW to pour water, just more than a trickle and it hurts my thumbs having to keep pushing in the spout button. Just not feasible to pour a teapot of water from this as it takes forever and my thumb aches. -why doesn't Zero Water CHANGE the slow drippy push button spout to a spigot so it can actually POUR (not slowly trickle)?
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Quick review: Clean water, lousy dispensing spout construction.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a city that has a lead warning on drinking water. We have a generic water filter, on the cold water line, under the sink. The reading for this cold water is 122. When I filter that water through the ZeroWater unit the reading drops to 0, so I'm pleased. I've only been using it 3 weeks, so I have no idea what the actual filter life will be. I hope at least a few months, since the filters are pricey. The reason this review is 4 stars is because I took 1 point off for the cheapo water spout construction. When I push in the dispenser button, water leaks out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Game & Music Addict

customer_reviews.title: Something is horribly wrong here
customer_reviews.text: First unit arrived with a broken release valve/button. They replaced that, so no worries. but second unit was in use for not even 30 days and it started emitting a vinegar-like taste and smell. I tested the water (with the tool they provided) and it was not a good reading (compared to spring water). The only give you one filter, so basically I got to use maybe3- 5 gallons of water then just threw the entire thing in the garbage. Complete waste of time and money. I thought I'd be getting something better since it seems to be a premium market price (not the cheapest). Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wilkins

product_meta.title: ZeroWater ZD-018 ZD018, 23 Cup Water Filter Pitcher with Water Quality Meter
product_meta.description: Design:Water Filter PitcherZeroWater's 23 Cup Water Filtration Dispenser is great for in home or small office usage. The sleek design includes a one-hand, push and pour spout that allows you to dispense water into your cup or favorite water bottle without any lifting. The 5-stage filter transforms your tap water into delicious, TDS-free drinking water. All ZeroWater products include a free Water Quality Meter to test your water to ensure the highest quality filtration on the market. Get more out of your water with ZeroWater's 5- Stage Water Filtration. 5-Stage Filtration: Stage 1 - Removes suspended solids such as dust and rust that make your water appear cloudy Stage 2 - Removes additional suspended solids Stage 3 - Removes organic contaminants; pesticides, herbicides, Mercury, Chlorine, Chloramine, and stops bacteria from growing Stage 4 - Removes inorganic compounds i.e. metals, nonmetals and radiological contaminants. Stage 5 - Removes remaining suspended solids, holds the resin in place What is TDS: Total Dissolved Solids (TDS) refer to minerals, salts, metals including lead, chemicals, fluoride and runoff polluting your drinking water. ZeroWater Technology is the only water filtration system to remove 99% of TDS, equivalent to TDS in purified bottled water. Get more out of your water with ZeroWater's Premium 5-Stage Water Filtration.
